Dispute_Type: Humanitarian and compassionate grounds for exemption
Legal_Issue: Whether the Minister's Delegate unreasonably assessed humanitarian and compassionate considerations
Outcome: Application dismissed, no certification for appeal
Procedural_Context: Judicial review under Section 72 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Type: Establishment in Canada, best interests of children, risks in country of origin
Legal_Provision: Section 25 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Degree of establishment in Canada not determinative, insufficient hardship shown
Application_Factor: Children's best interests, ties to Canada, risk in Mexico
Decision_Review_Issue: Unreasonable assessment of humanitarian and compassionate factors
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Section 25 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 25, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of delegate's decision
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Section 25
Procedural_Issue: Compliance with procedural requirements for exemption
